title: Pre Inca Temple of Pachacamac Half-Day Tour from Lima
description: Considered among the most important sites of interest in the countryside outside Lima, Pachacamac boasts a hidden history dating back to AD 200. On this half-day sightseeing tour with entrance fees and round-trip travel from Lima included, reach the temple complex in comfort by air-conditioned minivan. Explore with your informative guide, admire colorful murals in the Sun Temple, and gain insight into thousands of years of South American civilization.
all_descriptions: Considered among the most important sites of interest in the countryside outside Lima, Pachacamac boasts a hidden history dating back to AD 200. On this half-day sightseeing tour with entrance fees and round-trip travel from Lima included, reach the temple complex in comfort by air-conditioned minivan. Explore with your informative guide, admire colorful murals in the Sun Temple, and gain insight into thousands of years of South American civilization.

Begin your half-day tour with a morning pickup at your accommodation in the Miraflores or San Isidro neighborhood of Lima. Board your air-conditioned minivan and, with your guide sharing history and information along the way, take the scenic coastal route to Pachacamac, a perfectly preserved religious compound with evidence of human habitation dating back to AD 200.

On arrival at Pachacamac, explore the archaeological site and admire the Sun Temple, Moon Temple, and other features. Learn how 50 million sundried bricks were used in the temples’ construction, admire colorful murals uncovered by archaeologists over the years, gain insight into life in this part of the world thousands of years ago, and hear about the ancient Moche and Huari people who once called Pachacamac home.

After your in-depth tour of the Pachacamac temple complex, return in comfort to your starting point in Lima, where your tour ends.

Mike
Lima, Peru3 contributions

Family Fun

We had a wonderful time on this trip. We got picked up by the wonderful and knowledgeable Rosa and driven in a very nice van down to the site. Once there we got to tour the museum and then walk the grounds and view the ruins up close. It was so fascinating to have learned about a true hidden treasure.
